item.title: Irene add a quote by Katherine Mansfield
item.description: "Care no more for the opinions of others, for those voices. Do the hardest thing on earth for you. Act for yourself. Face the truth." -- Katherine Mansfield

item.title: Irene add a quote by Voltaire
item.description: "Love truth, but pardon error." -- Voltaire

item.title: Irene add a quote by John F. Kennedy
item.description: "The hottest places in hell are reserved for those who, in times of great moral crisis, maintain their neutrality." -- John F. Kennedy

item.title: Irene add a quote by William W. Purkey
item.description: "You've gotta dance like there's nobody watching, Love like you'll never be hurt, Sing like there's nobody listening, And live like it's heaven on earth." -- William W. Purkey

item.title: Irene add a quote by Andrzej Szczypiorski
item.description: "Swiat nie bylby taki zly, gdyby ludzie nie chcieli go naprawiac." -- Andrzej Szczypiorski

item.title: Irene add a quote by Andrzej Szczypiorski
item.description: "Nie ma takiego klamstwa, ktorego nie mozna wypowiedziec, aby dojsc do prawdy. Nie ma takiej przysiegi, ktorej nie mozna zlamac, aby ocalic wiernosc." -- Andrzej Szczypiorski

item.title: Irene add a quote by Voltaire
item.description: "Judge a man by his questions rather than by his answers." -- Voltaire

item.title: Irene add a quote by Henry Ward Beecherr
item.description: "Where is human nature so weak as in the bookstore?" -- Henry Ward Beecherr

item.title: Irene add a quote by Anya Seton
item.description: "Truth is naturally universal...and shines into many different windows, though many are clouded." -- Anya Seton

item.title: Irene add a quote by Anya Seton
item.description: "I am sure that no man asks mercy and grace with true meaning, but if mercy and grace have first been given him." -- Anya Seton

item.title: Irene add a quote by Dorothy Parker
item.description: "It's not the tragedies that kill us; it's the messes." -- Dorothy Parker

item.title: Irene add a quote by Anaïs Nin
item.description: "We don't see things as they are, we see them as we are." -- Anaïs Nin

item.title: Irene add a quote by David Schmahmann
item.description: "Memory may be mischievous but it is also remarkable, self-cleaning, creative, ultimately as magical as a prediction." -- David Schmahmann

item.title: Irene add a quote by David Schmahmann
item.description: "I wish we had left things undisturbed, exactly as they were and beneath whatever layers of silt had come to cover them, and yet I feel joy to be here." -- David Schmahmann

item.title: Irene add a quote by Alyson Richman
item.description: "She always told us there were two types of women. Those who are lit from the outside and those who are lit from within. The first needs the shimmer of a diamond to maker her sparkle, but for the other, her beauty is illuminated through the sheer light of her soul." -- Alyson Richman

item.title: Irene add a quote by Jorge Luis Borges
item.description: "I have always imagined that Paradise will be a kind of library." -- Jorge Luis Borges

item.title: Irene add a quote by Ann Patchett
item.description: "Never be so focused on what you're looking for that you overlook the thing you actually find." -- Ann Patchett

item.title: Irene add a quote by Lloyd Alexander
item.description: "Fantasy is hardly an escape from reality. It's a way of understanding it." -- Lloyd Alexander

item.title: Irene add a quote by Bertolt Brecht
item.description: "Hungry man, reach for the book: it is a weapon." -- Bertolt Brecht

item.title: Irene add a quote by Anonymous
item.description: "Love never fails. <i>—I Corinthians 13:8a</i>" -- Anonymous

item.title: Irene add a quote by Octavia Butler
item.description: "In order to rise From its own ashes A phoenix First Must Burn." -- Octavia Butler

item.title: Irene add a quote by William Wordsworth
Irene add a quote by Martin Amis
item.description: "Love is an abstract noun, something nebulous. And yet love turns out to be the only part of us that is solid, as the world turns upside down and the screen goes black." -- Martin Amis

item.title: Irene add a quote by Francois Duc de la Rochefoucauld
item.description: "Absence diminishes small loves and increases great ones, as the wind blows out the candle and fans the bonfire." -- Francois Duc de la Rochefoucauld

item.title: Irene add a quote by Howard Thurman
item.description: "Whatever may be the tensions and the stresses of a particular day, there is always lurking close at hand the trailing beauty of forgotten joy or unremembered peace." -- Howard Thurman

item.title: Irene add a quote by Niccolò Machiavelli
item.description: "Everyone sees what you appear to be, few experience what you really are." -- Niccolò Machiavelli

item.title: Irene add a quote by Anne Frank
item.description: "I can shake off everything as I write; my sorrows disappear, my courage is reborn." -- Anne Frank

item.title: Irene add a quote by Anthony Marra
item.description: "Life: a constellation of vital phenomena—organization, irritability, movement, growth, reproduction, adaptation." -- Anthony Marra

item.title: Irene add a quote by Hannah Kent
item.description: "To know what a person has done, and to know who a person is, are very different things." -- Hannah Kent

item.title: Irene add a quote by Chris Bohjalian
item.description: "But history does matter. There is a line connecting the Armenians and the Jews and the Cambodians and the Bosnians and the Rwandans. There are obviously more, but, really, how much genocide can one sentence handle?" -- Chris Bohjalian
